page.title: 03TUNSTEAD QUARRY BLASTING
page.content: When we went to Tunstead Quarry we interviewed some blasters, they told us that they blast once or twice a week depending on demand.They use Â£200,000 worth of explosives each year. They use a water-based high explosive called{Ammonium Nitrate } which is mixed with{diesel oil}.In one sack there is 40kg and about 910kg is used for each blast. They put 50kg of high explosives in each hole and there are about 18 holes. There are 6 to 8 people in a team who work a 7 hour shift and they get paid Â£130_140 a week. There are{3 sirens}with about a 4 minute interval then there is a continuous siren which lasts about 5 minutes . After the 5 minute siren there is silence for 1 minute then they blast.
